maml:description.maml:para: Closes a OneNote notebook. FUTURE PLANS: This cmdlet will support closing sections in the OpenSections container.
Closes a OneNote notebook.

maml:description.maml:param: The PowerShell path to the OneNote notebook to close.

maml:description.maml:para: The PowerShell path to the OneNote notebook to close.
Exports a OneNote item (notebook, section, page) to MHT, DOC, or PDF.

Export-OneNote exports a OneNote item to one of three formats: MHT, DOC, or PDF. There are two major ways to invoke the cmdlet. You can invoke by giving the path to a OneNote item in the PowerShell namespace (for example, <<OneNote:\WebNotebooks\OneNote Powershell Commands\Export-OneNote>>), or you can give it the OneNote hierarchy ID. (You typically get this by invoking Get-Item or Get-ChildItem on a OneNote path.)

maml:description.maml:param: Specifies the name of the exported file.
The physical path to a OneNote notebook to open and export. This differs from PsPath, which is a PowerShell path to a notebook that is already open.

Specifies the destination file path. This may be either a file path or a directory path, depending on if the Name parameter is also present. If the Name parameter is present, this is assumed to be a directory name. Otherwise, it is assumed to be a file name.
Unused. This value will be passed through to the output if present.

Specifies the output format. May be either MHT (default), DOC, PDF, ONEPKG, XPS, RSS, or WEB.
NOTE: RSS is not yet supported.
NOT YET SUPPORTED.
When exporting to web format, this optional parameter points to custom HTML/CSS/Javascript used to render the website.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the path to a OneNote item to export.
Specifies the name of the exported file.

Specifies the destination file path. This may be either a file path or a directory path, depending on if the Name parameter is also present. If the Name parameter is present, this is assumed to be a directory name. Otherwise, it is assumed to be a file name.
Unused. This value will be passed through to the output if present.

Specifies the output format. May be either MHT (default), DOC, PDF, ONEPKG, XPS, RSS, or WEB.
NOTE: RSS is not yet supported.
NOT YET SUPPORTED.
When exporting to web format, this optional parameter points to custom HTML/CSS/Javascript used to render the website.
Specifies the OneNote object ID to export.
The physical path to a OneNote notebook to open and export. This differs from PsPath, which is a PowerShell path to a notebook that is already open.
Contains information about the export: The OneNote object ID of the object that was exported, the output format, and the output path.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 1 --------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-OneNote 'OneNote:\Web Notebooks\OneNote Powershell Commands\Export-OneNote' -output c:\users\bdewey\e.pdf -format pdf

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command exports a OneNote page by name to PDF.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 2 --------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-ChildItem 'OneNote:\Web Notebooks\OneNote Powershell Commands' | Export-OneNote -OutputPath "${env:temp}\TestDoc" -Format MHT

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates one MHT file per page in the OneNote Powershell Commands section and saves them to ${env:temp}\TestDoc.
Creates a simple website based on the content of the OneNote notebook.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the XML representation of a OneNote notebook or section.

Get-OneNoteHierarchy lets you examine the structure of a OneNote notebook or section by giving you an XML document that describes that structure. You have the option of getting a parsed XML document or simply the XML string.

maml:description.maml:param: The OneNote ID of the item to query.

Determines how much of the hierarchy to return. Valid values are:
hsSelf -- Just return the hierarchy information for the specified OneNote item. hsChildren -- Return the hierarchy information for the specified OneNote item plus its immediate children. (For example, just the top-level sections of a notebook.) hsNotebooks -- Just return information about notebooks. hsSections -- Just return information about sections. hsPages -- return information about pages.
IMPORTANT: Unlike many things in Powershell, this parameter must be EXACT and it is CASE SENSITIVE. Invalid input is transparently transformed to hsSelf. As this is not the traditional PowerShell behavior for parameters, I will likely change it at some point.
If present, the XML string will be returned instead of the parsed XML document.

maml:description.maml:para: The PowerShell path to a OneNote item.

Determines how much of the hierarchy to return. Valid values are:
hsSelf -- Just return the hierarchy information for the specified OneNote item. hsChildren -- Return the hierarchy information for the specified OneNote item plus its immediate children. (For example, just the top-level sections of a notebook.) hsNotebooks -- Just return information about notebooks. hsSections -- Just return information about sections. hsPages -- return information about pages.
IMPORTANT: Unlike many things in Powershell, this parameter must be EXACT and it is CASE SENSITIVE. Invalid input is transparently transformed to hsSelf. As this is not the traditional PowerShell behavior for parameters, I will likely change it at some point.
If present, the XML string will be returned instead of the parsed XML document.
The OneNote ID of the item to query.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the hierarchy information for TempNotebook as a parsed XML object. Only the information for the notebook is returned, not any contained sections or pages.

command:commandLine.command:commandText: Type lastModifiedTime Name ---- ---------------- ---- Notebook 4/15/2007 3:47 PM TempNotebook

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the XML text defining the hierarchy of the TempNotebook notebook. Only the section information is returned, not page information.

command:commandLine.command:commandText: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?> <one:Notebook xmlns:one="http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/note/2007/onenote" name="TempNotebook" nickname="TempNotebook" ID="{131630BD-1BDF-4B0A-B8D6-13F32EA74164}{1}{B0}" path="C:\Users\bdewey\AppData\Local\Temp\TempNotebook" lastModifiedTime="2007-04-15T22:47:45.000Z" color="none"> <one:Section name="Section" ID="{81AACCDA-5920-4467-A8A7-3B5FA6C7F17F}{1}{B0}" path="C:\Users\bdewey\AppData\Local\Temp\TempNotebook\Section.one" lastModifiedTime="2007-04-15T22:47:45.000Z" color="#B7C997" /> <one:Section name="Section 2" ID="{0E7186DC-1B12-4B47-AC9E-2D8918B58244}{1}{B0}" path="C:\Users\bdewey\AppData\Local\Temp\TempNotebook\Section 2.one" lastModifiedTime="2007-04-15T22:47:37.000Z" color="#EE9597" /> <one:Section name="Foo" ID="{0E2DD5B2-9C1A-4C82-AD1C-AAD1CA81F84B}{1}{B0}" path="C:\Users\bdewey\AppData\Local\Temp\TempNotebook\Foo.one" lastModifiedTime="2007-04-15T22:47:37.000Z" color="#B49EDE" /> </one:Notebook>

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the hyperlink associated with a OneNote item.
Get-OneNoteHyperlink gets the OneNote hyperlink associated with any OneNote item.

maml:description.maml:param: Specifies the path to a OneNote item to export.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the OneNote object ID to export.
Specifies the path to a OneNote item to export.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the hyperlink for a page.
Gets the hyperlink to all top-level items in TempNotebook.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the XML defining what is on a OneNote page.

maml:description.maml:param: The PowerShell path to the page.
If present, the page content is returned as an unparsed XML string. Otherwise, a parsed object is returned.

maml:description.maml:para: The OneNote ID for the page.
If present, the page content is returned as an unparsed XML string. Otherwise, a parsed object is returned.
The PowerShell path to the page.
Creates a table of contents page for a notebook, section group, or section.

This cmdlet creates a table of contents page for a notebook, section group, or section. A table of contents is simply an outline view of the notebook, section group, or section with hyperlinks taking you to the specific content.

maml:description.maml:param: The PowerShell path to the OneNote item that you want the table of contents for. This needs to be a path to a Notebook, Section Group, or Section. You cannot give a path to a page.

A path to a section to put the TOC page in. If you omit this parameter and the -Path parameter points to a OneNote section, then the TOC page will be created in that section.
The parameter is required if -Path points to a OneNote notebook or section group.

Determines the depth of the TOC. Possible values include:
hsChildren -- Include only the direct child elements of -Path. hsPages -- Include all pages underneath -Path. hsSections -- Include only sections and section groups underneath -Path.
If set, the OneNote page XML will be output to the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: The PowerShell path to the OneNote item that you want the table of contents for. This needs to be a path to a Notebook, Section Group, or Section. You cannot give a path to a page.

A path to a section to put the TOC page in. If you omit this parameter and the -Path parameter points to a OneNote section, then the TOC page will be created in that section.
The parameter is required if -Path points to a OneNote notebook or section group.

Determines the depth of the TOC. Possible values include:
hsChildren -- Include only the direct child elements of -Path. hsPages -- Include all pages underneath -Path. hsSections -- Include only sections and section groups underneath -Path.
If set, the OneNote page XML will be output to the pipeline.
Updates the content of a OneNote page.

maml:description.maml:param: The PowerShell path to the page.
The OneNote XML representing the new page content.
If present, the XML will be passed through the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: The PowerShell path to the page.
The OneNote XML representing the new page content.
If present, the XML will be passed through the pipeline.

maml:alert.maml:para: Likely the wrong verb. It should be Add-OneNotePageContent, as this can never DELETE content from a page.
